conclusion: B is the only block that is pulled, so the horizontal force acting on the whole system is the single external force F.
The surface is smooth, so there are no other horizontal external forces.
Block D is accelerated only by the static friction force exerted on it by block C.
To give block D the same acceleration a, the friction force must satisfy f_s = m a = m (F / (4 m)) = F / 4
Direction of static friction force is to the right (same as the pulling force).
The magnitude of the static friction force acting on block D is F ⁄ 4.
